addressleaf.section:
Copie of my letter to the Bourgmasters and Bourgers of
e towne of
Groeninghen.
Oc
t
26 1591

page.lettertext:
fol.133r
Right woorshipfull &c. It is two yeres agoe
that I was informed, of
e good inclination
of some of yo
r
bourgeosie, to deliver their con-
trey from
e Spanishe servitude, and to restoare
it againe to his ancient libertie, by
e assist
a
ce
and defence of my souveraigne Lady and mi-
stresse
e
Q. Ma
tie
of
England:
for w
ch
I
thought it then my duty, residing heere in
these contreis for her Ma
ties
affaires, to notifie
unto yo
w
,
at in case yo
w
would dispose
yo
r
selves thorowly to so sounde a resolution,
I did not doubt, but to procure unto yo
w
from her Ma
tie
a very ample satisfaction, to
e uttermost advantage of w
at
soever thing
in reason yo
w
should require to
at effect.
Howe
at letter was accepted, and what good
it had wrought in
e hartes of good patriots,
I was never sins advertised. Nevertheles
because I see to what termes yo
r
governm
t
is growen, and howe fast yo
r
miserie doth
increase upon yo
w
, by adhering to
e Spa-
niard, I am moved once againe to resume
at subject of my former letter, and in con-
formitie therof to advise yo
w
most ear-
nestly, to consider w
t
greater care yo
r
ser-
vile condition, and to propose some better
meanes, then yo
w
have practised yet hi-
therto, for
e preservation of yo
r
contrey.
To use any arguments of persuasion, to in-
duce therunto, I knowe it is superfluous.
For it must be yo
w
of yo
r
selves,
at must
persuade yo
r
selves unto it. Yo
w
see
fol.133v
before yo
r
eies
e lamentable state, wherto
those other Provinces, w
ch
are associat w
t
yo
w
,
and in subjection to
e Spaniard, are violently
drawen: w
t
out respect at all in him to
e good
of any towne, but to accomplishe in generall
his ambitious deseignes. Yow see in w
at
flo-
rishing measure these Provinces united are bles-
sed by God, and howe they prosper continually,
in all their actions and attemptes. Yo
w
see
yowr owne calamitie, and can conferre yo
r
former times, w
t
yo
r
present declination:
in w
ch
notw
t
standing yo
w
are not yet so deep
ly plounged, but
at yo
w
may by a good aggree-
ment, and by
e benefit of trafficke w
t
e people
of these contreis, and also by suche favo
rs
, as
yo
w
may easely obtene of
e Q. my souveraigne,
repare yo
r
badde estate, and come to more
prosperitie, then yo
w
have ever yet enjoied.
These are suche motives, to cause yo
w
to sur-
cease from yo
r
obstinat courses, as there can
be nothing more effectual. For w
ch
I neede
but referre yo
w
to yo
r
owne cogitations, and to
that w
ch
yo
w
have founde by
e experience
of yo
r
selves. Onely this I am to signifie,
and also to assure yo
w
, in as confident ma-
ner, as yo
w
can any way require, That if
yo
w
shall determine in convenient time (before
by force of armes yo
w
be driven to suche
conditions as
e Conquero
r
will impose) to
reduce yo
r
native contrey to his wonted an-
cient dignitie, and fully to restablishe all
yo
r
privileges and liberties: whether it be
at
yo
w
resolve to attene therunto by
e helpe of her
fol.134r
Ma
tie
and by submitting yo
r
Province to her
onely Protection: or shall otherwise desire to
be onely of
e union, w
t
e rest of these Pro-
vinces, w
t
good warrant from her Ma
tie
at
whatsoever composition yo
w
and they shall
sette downe, shall stande inviolable, yo
w
shall finde her Hig
nes
most ready to em-
brace any course,
at may best content yo
w
.
And for yo
r
better assurance, if yo
w
please
to depute any one from among yo
w
, to come
hither, or will have some person sent from
hens, to some neutral place of safetie, neere
unto yo
r
selves, I will take what order yo
w
thinke best: and will make yo
w
both pri-
vy to a suffic ie nt Co[mission, w
ch
I have
had already from her Ma
tie
to deale w
t
yo
r
Province in those former respectes, and
likewise undertake to procure the speedy ans-
wear to any article or motion
at yo
w
please to make besides.
And so recom-
mending
e consideration of yo
r
owne
estate to yo
r
best discretions, and pro-
mising for my self my carefullest ende-
vo
r
for
e advancem
t
of yo
r
libertie,
I &c./.
From
e Hage. Oc
t
26 1591.
